means: 刮擦( abrade的过去式和过去分词 )

sentence.Network_en: My skin was abraded and very tender.
Much of the skin on her arm was abraded.

sentence.Network_en: Their gossips abraded her into restlessness.
sentence.Network_cn: 他们的流言蜚语使她心烦意乱.

entry.def: To abrade something means to scrape or wear down its surface by rubbing it.

example.ex: My skin was abraded and very tender.
